chapters.chapter_summary: Arjuna's grief and confusion overwhelm him as he observes his relatives and teachers in the opposing army. His crisis of conscience sets the stage for Krishna's teachings.

verses.transliteration: dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavah
verses.hindi_translation: धर्म की भूमि कुरुक्षेत्र में, युद्ध के लिए तत्पर होकर, मेरे सैनिक और पाण्डव क्या करने लगे?
verses.english_translation: On the sacred field of Kurukshetra, having gathered with the intention to fight, what did my people and the Pandavas do?
verses.commentary: Opening verse establishing the setting and beginning of the Bhagavad Gita narrative.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मे अच्युत।
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvācha senyor ubhayor madhye rathaṁ sthāpaya me achyuta
verses.hindi_translation: अर्जुन ने कहा: हे अच्युत! दोनों सेनाओं के बीच मेरे रथ को खड़ा करो।
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna! Place my chariot between both armies.
verses.commentary: Arjuna's request to survey the opposing forces, beginning his crisis.

verses.sanskrit: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च।
verses.transliteration: na kāṅkṣe vijayaṁ kṛṣṇa na cha rājyaṁ sukhāni cha
verses.hindi_translation: हे कृष्ण! मैं विजय, राज्य और सुखों की कामना नहीं करता।
verses.english_translation: O Krishna! I do not desire victory, kingdom, or pleasures.
verses.commentary: Arjuna's declaration of renunciation, showing his ethical depth.

verses.transliteration: āchāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathāiva cha pitāmahāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: आचार्य, पिता, पुत्र, दादा, मामा - ये सभी मेरे संबंधी हैं।
verses.english_translation: Teachers, fathers, sons, grandfathers - all my relations are here.
verses.commentary: Arjuna enumerates his relationships with those on the opposite side.

verses.transliteration: na hantum ichchhāmi ghnato 'pi madhusūdan
verses.hindi_translation: हे मधुसूदन! मैं इन्हें न मारना चाहता हूँ, भले ही ये मुझे मार दें।
verses.english_translation: O Madhusudana! I do not wish to kill them, even if they kill me.
verses.commentary: Arjuna's core ethical objection to participating in the war.

verses.transliteration: nihatya dhārtarāṣṭrān naḥ kā prītiḥ syāt janārdana
verses.hindi_translation: हे जनार्दन! धृतराष्ट्र के पुत्रों को मारकर हमें क्या खुशी मिलेगी?
verses.english_translation: O Janardana! What joy can we have in slaying the sons of Dhritarashtra?
verses.commentary: Arjuna questions the justification for the war from a karmic perspective.

verses.sanskrit: कथं भीष्ममहं संख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन।
verses.transliteration: kathaṁ bhīṣmam ahaṁ saṅkhye droṇaṁ cha madhusūdan
verses.hindi_translation: हे मधुसूदन! मैं युद्ध में भीष्म और द्रोण को कैसे मार सकता हूँ?
verses.english_translation: O Madhusudana! How can I fight Bhishma and Drona in battle?
verses.commentary: Arjuna's respect for his elders and teachers prevents him from fighting.

verses.transliteration: gurūn ahatvā hi mahānubhavān śreyo bhoktuṁ bhaikṣyam iha loke
verses.hindi_translation: इस लोक में महान गुरुओं को न मारकर भीख माँग कर खाना ही अच्छा है।
verses.english_translation: It is better to eat alms than to enjoy pleasures stained with the blood of elders.
verses.commentary: Arjuna expresses his moral preference for poverty over killing his gurus.

verses.sanskrit: न चैव ज्ञायते कतरन्नो गरीयो यदि वा जयेम।
verses.transliteration: na chaiva jñāyate karan no garīyo yadi vā jayem
verses.hindi_translation: मैं यह नहीं जानता कि हमारी जीत अच्छी है या हार।
verses.english_translation: I do not know what is better for us - victory or defeat.
verses.commentary: Arjuna's complete confusion and moral paralysis at this point.

verses.transliteration: kārpanya-doṣopahata-svabhāvaḥ pṛchhāmi tvāṁ dharma-sammūḍha-chetāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: दोषपूर्ण हृदय से, मैं तुमसे पूछता हूँ, धर्म में भ्रमित मन के साथ।
verses.english_translation: Weakened by cowardice, my mind bewildered about dharma, I ask you for guidance.
verses.commentary: Arjuna's final confession of his state of confusion before falling silent.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna teaches the philosophy of the eternal soul, the concept of dharma, yoga, and nishkama karma. This is considered the most important chapter containing fundamental teachings.

verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvācha kutas tvā kaśmalam idaṁ viṣame samupasthitam
verses.hindi_translation: श्रीभगवान ने कहा: हे अर्जुन! इस समय तुम्हें यह कमजोरी कहाँ से आई?
verses.english_translation: The Blessed Lord said: From where has this delusion come to you in this critical moment?
verses.commentary: Krishna begins his response to Arjuna's crisis with a direct challenge.

verses.sanskrit: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते।
verses.transliteration: klaibyaṁ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitat tvayy upapadyate
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! नपुंसकता को मत प्राप्त हो। तुम्हारे लिए यह उचित नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: Do not yield to cowardice, O Partha! This does not befit you.
verses.commentary: Krishna urges Arjuna to overcome his emotional weakness and stand up to his duty.

verses.transliteration: aśochyān anvaśocas tvaṁ prajñā-vādāṁś cha bhāṣase
verses.hindi_translation: तुम जिन्हें शोक योग्य नहीं हैं, उनके लिए शोक कर रहे हो।
verses.english_translation: You grieve for those who should not be mourned and speak words of wisdom.
verses.commentary: Krishna points out Arjuna's logical inconsistency in his grief.

verses.sanskrit: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः।
verses.transliteration: na tv evāhaṁ jātu nāsaṁ na tvaṁ neme janādhipāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: न तो मैं कभी नहीं था, न तुम कभी नहीं थे, न ये राजा लोग कभी नहीं थे।
verses.english_translation: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings.
verses.commentary: Fundamental teaching on the eternity of the soul - the foundation of all subsequent teachings.

verses.transliteration: dehino 'smin yathā dehe kaumāraṁ yauvanam jarā
verses.hindi_translation: जैसे इस शरीर में आत्मा बचपन, यौवन और बुढ़ापे से गुजरता है।
verses.english_translation: As the embodied soul passes through childhood, youth, and old age in this body.
verses.commentary: The metaphor of the soul's journey through different life stages, illustrating the concept of reincarnation.

verses.transliteration: mātrāspraśās tu kauntey śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkha-dāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: हे कुंती के पुत्र! इंद्रियों के विषय सर्दी-गर्मी और सुख-दुःख को देते हैं।
verses.english_translation: O son of Kunti! The contacts of the senses with their objects cause sensations of heat and cold, pleasure and pain.
verses.commentary: Teaching on the transient nature of sensory experiences and the need for equanimity.

verses.sanskrit: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ।
verses.transliteration: yaṁ hi na vyathayantyas te puruṣaṁ purusarṣabha
verses.hindi_translation: हे पुरुषश्रेष्ठ! जिस पुरुष को ये व्यथित नहीं करते, वह मोक्ष के योग्य है।
verses.english_translation: O bull among men! The person whom these sensations do not disturb is fit for immortality.
verses.commentary: The ideal of equanimity (samatva) - remaining unaffected by dualities of pleasure and pain.

verses.sanskrit: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः।
verses.transliteration: nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ
verses.hindi_translation: असत् का कोई भाव नहीं है और सत् का कोई अभाव नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: The unreal has no existence; the real never ceases to be.
verses.commentary: The fundamental principle distinguishing the eternal Brahman from the temporary material world.

verses.sanskrit: अविनाशि तु तद्वेद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्।
verses.transliteration: avināśi tu tad veddhi yen sarvam idaṁ tatam
verses.hindi_translation: जान कि वह अविनाशी है, जिससे यह सब कुछ व्याप्त है।
verses.english_translation: Know that which pervades the entire body is indestructible.
verses.commentary: The Atman is the indestructible essence pervading all existence.

verses.transliteration: antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śarīriṇaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: ये सब शरीर क्षणभंगुर हैं, किंतु जिसमें ये शरीर हैं वह नित्य है।
verses.english_translation: These bodies are said to end, but He who dwells in the body is eternal.
verses.commentary: Direct application of the Atman's eternity - commanding Arjuna to fight.

verses.sanskrit: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम्।
verses.transliteration: ya enaṁ vetti hantāraṁ yaś chainaṁ manyate hatam
verses.hindi_translation: जो इसे मारने वाला समझता है और जो इसे मरा हुआ समझता है, दोनों ही नहीं जानते।
verses.english_translation: He who thinks this Atman slays, and he who thinks it is slain, both do not understand.
verses.commentary: Clarification that the Atman cannot be killed - both slayer and slain misunderstand its nature.

verses.sanskrit: न जायते मियते वा कदाचिन्नायं भूतवा भविता वा न भूयः।
verses.transliteration: na jāyate miyate vā kadāchin nāyaṁ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: यह न जन्म लेता है और न मरता है। यह अजन्मा, नित्य, शाश्वत और पुरातन है।
verses.english_translation: The Atman is never born, nor does it die. It is unborn, eternal, permanent, and primaeval.
verses.commentary: Comprehensive statement of the Atman's qualities - timeless and transcendent existence.

verses.transliteration: vedāvināśinaṁ nityaṁ ya enām ajam avyayam
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! जो पुरुष इस अविनाशी, नित्य, अजन्मा को जानता है, वह कैसे किसी को मार सकता है?
verses.english_translation: O Partha! One who knows the Atman to be indestructible can never kill anyone.
verses.commentary: True knowledge of the Atman naturally leads to understanding that killing is impossible.

verses.sanskrit: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि।
verses.transliteration: vāsāṁsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya navāni gṛhṇāti naro 'parāṇi
verses.hindi_translation: जैसे मनुष्य पुरानी वस्त्रों को त्यागकर नई वस्त्रें पहनता है।
verses.english_translation: As a person sheds worn-out garments and puts on new ones, so the Atman casts off worn-out bodies.
verses.commentary: The famous metaphor explaining reincarnation through the analogy of changing clothes.

verses.sanskrit: नैनं छिंदन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः।
verses.transliteration: nainaṁ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṁ dahati pāvakaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: इस आत्मा को न तो शस्त्र काट सकते हैं, न आग जला सकती है।
verses.english_translation: Weapons cannot pierce the Atman, fire cannot burn it, water cannot wet it.
verses.commentary: Emphasis on the imperviousness of the Atman to all physical forces.

verses.sanskrit: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च।
verses.transliteration: jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyu dhruvaṁ janma mṛtasya cha
verses.hindi_translation: जन्मे हुए की मृत्यु निश्चित है और मरे हुए का जन्म निश्चित है।
verses.english_translation: Death is certain for the born, and birth is certain for the dead.
verses.commentary: The inevitability of the life and death cycle - a fact that requires acceptance.

verses.transliteration: sva-dharmam api chāvekṣya na vikampitum arhasi
verses.hindi_translation: अपने धर्म को भी ध्यान में रखते हुए, तुम्हें विचलित नहीं होना चाहिए।
verses.english_translation: Consider also your own duty and do not hesitate. For a warrior, there is nothing greater than a righteous battle.
verses.commentary: Introduction of the concept of Svadharma - duty according to one's position and nature.

verses.transliteration: yadṛchhayā chopapannaṁ svarga-dvāram apāvṛtam
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! भाग्य से मिला यह युद्ध जो स्वर्ग के द्वार को खोल देता है।
verses.english_translation: O Partha! Fortunate warriors obtain such a battle that is like an open gate to heaven.
verses.commentary: Krishna describes the opportunity to fight in a righteous war as spiritually auspicious.

verses.transliteration: sukha-duḥkhe same kṛtvā lābhālābhau jayājayau
verses.hindi_translation: सुख-दुःख को समान मानकर, लाभ-हानि को बराबर समझकर, युद्ध के लिए तत्पर हो।
verses.english_translation: Treating pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat as equal, engage in battle.
verses.commentary: The practice of Samatva (equanimity) in action - the essence of nishkama karma.

verses.transliteration: karmaṇy evādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadāchana
verses.hindi_translation: तुम्हारा अधिकार केवल कर्म करने में है, कभी भी फल में नहीं।
verses.english_translation: You have the right to work only, but never to its fruits. Never be the cause of results.
verses.commentary: The central teaching of Nishkama Karma - performing duty without attachment to results.

verses.sanskrit: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय।
verses.transliteration: yoga-sthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṁgaṁ tyaktvā dhanañjaya
verses.hindi_translation: हे धनञ्जय! योग में स्थित होकर कर्म करो, आसक्ति को त्यागकर।
verses.english_translation: Perform your duties with equanimity, O Dhananjaya, abandoning attachment.
verses.commentary: Krishna defines Yoga as performing action while maintaining equanimity toward results.

verses.transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīh ubhe sukṛta-duṣkṛte
verses.hindi_translation: जो बुद्धि-युक्त है, वह यहाँ पुण्य और पाप दोनों को त्याग देता है।
verses.english_translation: One established in wisdom renounces both merit and demerit here. Therefore, devote yourself to Yoga.
verses.commentary: Enlightened action transcends the categories of good and bad - true wisdom lies beyond duality.

verses.transliteration: prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārth mano-gatān
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! जब मनुष्य सभी कामनाओं को त्याग देता है, वह स्थितप्रज्ञ है।
verses.english_translation: O Partha! When a person abandons all the desires that arise in the mind, he is said to have steady wisdom.
verses.commentary: Definition of the enlightened person - one who has transcended desires and found satisfaction in the Atman.

verses.transliteration: dhyāyato viṣayān puṁsaḥ saṅgas teṣūpajāyate
verses.hindi_translation: जब पुरुष विषयों का ध्यान करता है, तो उनमें आसक्ति उत्पन्न होती है।
verses.english_translation: When a person dwells on sensory objects, attachment develops.
verses.commentary: Beginning of the chain describing how desire leads to negative consequences - a critical teaching.

verses.transliteration: krodhād bhavati sammohah sammohat sṛti-vibhramaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: क्रोध से मोह होता है, मोह से स्मृति विभ्रम होता है।
verses.english_translation: From anger arises delusion, from delusion the confusion of memory.
verses.commentary: Continuation of the chain - anger leads to delusion and loss of intelligence, ultimately to self-destruction.

verses.transliteration: indriyāṇāṁ hi charatāṁ yan mano 'nuvidhīyate
verses.hindi_translation: जब मन विचरण करती हुई इंद्रियों का अनुसरण करता है, तो बुद्धि को हरण कर लेता है।
verses.english_translation: For one whose mind follows the wandering senses, wisdom is carried away like a boat swept away by wind.
verses.commentary: The danger of an uncontrolled mind - loss of wisdom and spiritual destruction.

verses.transliteration: āpūryamāṇam achala-pratiṣṭhaṁ samudram āpaḥ praviśanti yadvat
verses.hindi_translation: जैसे जल समुद्र में प्रवेश करते हैं, लेकिन समुद्र में कोई परिवर्तन नहीं होता।
verses.english_translation: As all waters merge into the ocean without disturbing its equilibrium, so all desires merge into one without disturbing his peace.
verses.commentary: Beautiful metaphor - the equanimous sage remains unmoved like the ocean, indifferent to desires.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna teaches that action without attachment to results is superior to inaction. He explains the philosophy of Nishkama Karma and the importance of performing one's duties without selfish motivation.

verses.transliteration: na hi kaśchit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty akarmakṛt
verses.hindi_translation: कोई भी क्षण भर के लिए भी निष्क्रिय नहीं रह सकता है।
verses.english_translation: Not for a moment can anyone remain without performing action.
verses.commentary: Everyone is bound to perform action according to their nature and the gunas.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन्।
verses.transliteration: karmendriyāṇi saṁyamya ya āste manasā smaran
verses.hindi_translation: जो कर्मेंद्रियों को नियंत्रित करके, मन से विषयों का स्मरण करता है।
verses.english_translation: One who controls the action senses but mentally dwells on the objects of the senses.
verses.commentary: External control without mental discipline is incomplete and leads to confusion.

verses.sanskrit: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः।
verses.transliteration: niyataṁ kuru karma tvaṁ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: तुम अपने निर्धारित कर्म को करो। कर्म अकर्म से बेहतर है।
verses.english_translation: Perform your prescribed duty, for action is superior to inaction.
verses.commentary: Doing one's duty, even with difficulty, is better than avoiding responsibility.

verses.transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo 'nyatra loko 'yaṁ karma-bandhanah
verses.hindi_translation: यज्ञ के लिए किए गए कर्म के अलावा अन्य कर्मों से लोक बन्धित है।
verses.english_translation: This world is bound by action, unless action is performed as sacrifice. Therefore, perform action as a sacrifice, free from attachment.
verses.commentary: Action performed selflessly (yagna) liberates, while selfish action binds.

verses.transliteration: ya idaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣv abhidhāsyati
verses.hindi_translation: जो इस परम गुह्य को मेरे भक्तों को सिखाएगा।
verses.english_translation: One who teaches this supreme secret to My devotees performs the greatest service.
verses.commentary: Sharing this knowledge with sincere seekers is the highest form of service.

verses.sanskrit: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन।
verses.transliteration: na me pārthāsti kartavyaṁ triṣu lokeṣu kiñchana
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! मेरे लिए तीनों लोकों में कोई कर्तव्य नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: O Partha! There is nothing in all the three worlds that I need to do, nor is there anything I have not obtained.
verses.commentary: Krishna illustrates how the divine, being complete, acts without selfish motivation.

verses.sanskrit: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मणि यत्निमान्।
verses.transliteration: yadi hy ahaṁ na varteyaṁ jātu karmaṇi yatnimaān
verses.hindi_translation: यदि मैं कर्मों में कर्तव्यपरायण न होता।
verses.english_translation: If I did not engage in action, all the worlds would collapse.
verses.commentary: The divine purpose of action - to maintain cosmic order and set an example for others.

verses.transliteration: loka-saṅgraham evāpi sādhya karmev tadeha saḥ
verses.hindi_translation: इसलिए तुम्हें भी सार्वजनिक कल्याण के लिए कर्तव्यपरायण होना चाहिए।
verses.english_translation: Therefore, you should also work for the welfare of the world.
verses.commentary: Actions performed for the welfare of society, not selfish gain, lead to spiritual progress.

verses.sanskrit: साक्षिभूते न कर्तृत्वं कर्मनो यदि मानते।
verses.transliteration: sākṣibhūte na kartṛtvaṁ karmano yadi māante
verses.hindi_translation: यदि बुद्धिमान सर्व काम कर्नी नहीं समझते, तो वह कर्ता नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: If the wise one does not consider himself the doer of actions while seeing clearly, he is not the real agent.
verses.commentary: Understanding that one is not the actual doer (witness consciousness) leads to freedom.

verses.transliteration: prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: सभी कर्म प्रकृति के तीनों गुणों द्वारा किए जाते हैं।
verses.english_translation: All actions are performed by the gunas of nature. The deluded think of himself as the doer.
verses.commentary: True knowledge is understanding that the Gunas (qualities of nature) are the real agents of action.

verses.transliteration: tattva-vidbhiḥ tu mahā-bāho guṇa-karma-vibhāgayoḥ
verses.hindi_translation: हे महाबाहो! लेकिन जो तत्त्वज्ञानी हैं, वे गुणों और कर्मों के विभाजन को जानते हैं।
verses.english_translation: But one who knows the truth about the division of the gunas and their actions is not attached.
verses.commentary: True knowledge brings detachment from the fruits of action.

verses.transliteration: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi sannyasyādhyātma-chetasā
verses.hindi_translation: मुझमें सभी कर्मों को अर्पित करके, आध्यात्मिक चेतना के साथ कर्म करो।
verses.english_translation: Dedicate all your actions to Me and perform them with your mind absorbed in the Atman.
verses.commentary: Performing all actions as an offering to the divine leads to spiritual liberation.

verses.transliteration: sadṛśaṁ cheṣṭate svasyāḥ prakṛteḥ jñānavān api
verses.hindi_translation: जानकार भी अपनी प्रकृति के अनुसार कर्म करता है।
verses.english_translation: Even the wise act according to their nature. All beings follow their nature.
verses.commentary: One should perform duties according to their nature and position, not imitate others.

verses.transliteration: śreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt suṇuṣṭhitāt
verses.hindi_translation: अपना धर्म, भले ही दोषपूर्ण हो, दूसरे के धर्म से श्रेष्ठ है।
verses.english_translation: It is better to perform one's own duty imperfectly than another's duty perfectly.
verses.commentary: Emphasis on performing one's own duty (svadharma) according to one's position and nature.

verses.sanskrit: अथ केन प्रयुक्तो ऽयं पापं चरति पुरुषः।
verses.transliteration: atha kena prayukto 'yaṁ pāpaṁ charati puruṣaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: अब यह बताओ, कौन इस पुरुष को पाप के लिए प्रेरित करता है?
verses.english_translation: But what impels a person to commit sin against his will?
verses.commentary: Arjuna asks about the force that drives people toward sinful actions despite their better judgment.

verses.transliteration: kāma eṣa krodha eṣa rajo-guṇa-samud-bhavaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: यह काम है, यह क्रोध है, जो रजोगुण से उत्पन्न होता है।
verses.english_translation: This desire and anger arise from the Rajas guna. They are voracious and greatly sinful.
verses.commentary: Desire and anger, born from Rajas (the quality of passion), are the main obstacles to spiritual progress.

verses.transliteration: tasmāt tvam indriyāṇ ādau niyamya bhrata-riśabha
verses.hindi_translation: इसलिए हे भरतश्रेष्ठ! पहले तुम्हें इंद्रियों को नियंत्रित करना चाहिए।
verses.english_translation: Therefore, O bull among the descendants of Bharata! First subdue the senses.
verses.commentary: The practical path to spiritual progress begins with control and discipline of the senses.

verses.transliteration: indriyāṇi parāṇy āhur indriyebhyaḥ paraṁ manaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: इंद्रियाँ श्रेष्ठ हैं, इंद्रियों से मन श्रेष्ठ है।
verses.english_translation: The senses are superior to the gross body, the mind is superior to the senses.
verses.commentary: Hierarchy of consciousness - from physical to mental to intellectual to spiritual dimensions.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna reveals the concept of divine incarnation and the importance of knowledge. He describes how actions are purified through knowledge and emphasizes the superiority of knowledge over action.

verses.sanskrit: बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन।
verses.transliteration: bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava chārjuna
verses.hindi_translation: हे अर्जुन! मेरे और तुम्हारे कई जन्म हो चुके हैं।
verses.english_translation: Many births of Mine and yours have passed, O Arjuna.
verses.commentary: Introduction of the concept of divine incarnation and cyclic rebirths.

verses.transliteration: ajo 'pi sann avyayātmā bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi san
verses.hindi_translation: यद्यपि मैं अजन्मा हूँ, अविनाशी आत्मा हूँ, और सभी प्राणियों का स्वामी हूँ।
verses.english_translation: Though I am unborn and eternal, and though I am the Lord of all beings.
verses.commentary: Krishna describes his divine nature - unborn, eternal, and omniscient.

verses.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत।
verses.transliteration: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārat
verses.hindi_translation: हे भारत! जब भी धर्म की हानि होती है।
verses.english_translation: O Bharata! Whenever there is a decline of righteousness.
verses.commentary: The beginning of the famous Avatara Yoga - the principle of divine incarnation for cosmic restoration.

verses.transliteration: abhyutthānāya sādhūnāṁ vināśāya cha duṣkṛtām
verses.hindi_translation: साधुओं की रक्षा के लिए और दुष्टों का विनाश करने के लिए।
verses.english_translation: For the protection of the righteous and the destruction of the wicked.
verses.commentary: The purpose of divine incarnation - to preserve virtue and eliminate vice.

verses.sanskrit: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः।
verses.transliteration: janma karma cha me divyam evaṁ yo vetti tattvataḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जो मेरे दिव्य जन्म और कर्मों को तत्त्व से जानता है।
verses.english_translation: One who knows the divine nature of My birth and actions in truth.
verses.commentary: Understanding the divine incarnation leads to liberation.

verses.transliteration: chātur-varṇyaṁ mayā sṛṣṭaṁ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: मैंने गुणों और कर्मों के भेद से चार वर्णों की रचना की है।
verses.english_translation: The four-fold caste system has been created by Me based on the division of qualities and work.
verses.commentary: The varna system is based on natural qualities and occupations, not birth alone.

verses.sanskrit: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा।
verses.transliteration: na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛhā
verses.hindi_translation: कर्म मुझे प्रदूषित नहीं करते, और न ही मेरी कर्मों के फलों में इच्छा है।
verses.english_translation: Actions do not taint Me, nor do I have any desire for the fruits of action.
verses.commentary: The divine is unaffected by karma, remaining ever pure and free from attachment.

verses.transliteration: kiṁ karma kimakarmeti kavayo 'py atra mohitāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: क्या कर्म है, क्या अकर्म है, इस विषय में विद्वान भी भ्रमित होते हैं।
verses.english_translation: Even the learned are confused about what is action and what is inaction.
verses.commentary: The paradox of action and inaction - a profound topic that even wise people struggle to understand.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः।
verses.transliteration: karmaṇo hy api boddhavyaṁ boddhavyaṁ cha vikarmaṇaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: कर्म को जानना और विकर्म को जानना दोनों आवश्यक हैं।
verses.english_translation: One should understand action as well as forbidden action.
verses.commentary: Proper understanding of the three types of action is essential for spiritual progress.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः।
verses.transliteration: karmaṇy akrama yaḥ paśyed akarmani cha karma yaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जो कर्म में अकर्म देखे और अकर्म में कर्म देखे।
verses.english_translation: One who sees inaction in action and action in inaction.
verses.commentary: The enlightened perspective - understanding the paradoxical nature of action and inaction.

verses.transliteration: gata-saṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthita-chetasaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जो आसक्ति से मुक्त, ज्ञान में स्थित चित्त वाले हैं।
verses.english_translation: One who is free from attachment, liberated, and whose mind is established in knowledge.
verses.commentary: The characteristics of the self-realized person - freedom, knowledge, and inner stability.

verses.transliteration: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā
verses.hindi_translation: इसे प्रणाम, प्रश्न और सेवा द्वारा समझो।
verses.english_translation: Know this by prostration, inquiry, and service.
verses.commentary: The three methods of receiving spiritual knowledge - humility, questions, and selfless service.

verses.transliteration: yajña-śiṣṭāśinaḥ santo muchyante sarva-kilbiṣaiḥ
verses.hindi_translation: यज्ञ से बचा अन्न खाने वाले संतजन सभी पापों से मुक्त हो जाते हैं।
verses.english_translation: The righteous who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins.
verses.commentary: The sanctifying power of performing actions as offerings and sharing with others.

verses.transliteration: jñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute arjun
verses.hindi_translation: हे अर्जुन! ज्ञान की अग्नि सभी कर्मों को भस्म कर देती है।
verses.english_translation: O Arjuna! The fire of knowledge reduces all actions to ashes.
verses.commentary: Knowledge is the ultimate purifier - it destroys the karmic consequences of all past actions.

verses.sanskrit: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।
verses.transliteration: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṁ pavitram iha vidyate
verses.hindi_translation: निश्चित रूप से इस संसार में ज्ञान के समान पवित्र कुछ नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: There is no purifier in this world comparable to knowledge.
verses.commentary: Knowledge is the supreme purifying force, surpassing all rituals and practices.

verses.transliteration: śraddhāvān labhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ saṁyatendriyaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जो श्रद्धावान और परायण है, इंद्रियों को नियंत्रित करता है, वह ज्ञान को प्राप्त करता है।
verses.english_translation: One who has faith and is devoted, with senses under control, obtains knowledge.
verses.commentary: The qualifications for obtaining self-knowledge - faith, dedication, and sense control.

verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śāntim achireṇādhigachhati
verses.hindi_translation: ज्ञान को प्राप्त करके, वह शीघ्र ही परम शांति को प्राप्त करता है।
verses.english_translation: Having obtained knowledge, one quickly attains supreme peace.
verses.commentary: Knowledge leads directly to spiritual liberation and eternal peace.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna discusses the equivalence of renunciation and yoga of action. He explains that true renunciation is not abandonment of action but performing action without attachment.

verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvācha sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaś cha niḥ-śreyasa-karāv ubhau
verses.hindi_translation: श्रीभगवान ने कहा: संन्यास और कर्म-योग दोनों कल्याण के लिए हैं।
verses.english_translation: The Blessed Lord said: Both renunciation and the yoga of action lead to the highest good.
verses.commentary: Both paths, properly practiced, lead to liberation - they are not contradictory.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति।
verses.transliteration: jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati
verses.hindi_translation: जो न किसी से द्वेष करता है और न किसी की कामना करता है, वह नित्य संन्यासी है।
verses.english_translation: The person who neither hates nor desires anything is the real renunciate.
verses.commentary: True renunciation is an inner attitude of non-attachment, not merely external withdrawal.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। संन्यासं कर्मयोगं च पृथक् बुद्धा धनञ्जय।
verses.transliteration: arjun uvācha sannyāsaṁ karma-yogaṁ cha pṛthak buddhā dhanañjay
verses.hindi_translation: अर्जुन ने कहा: हे धनञ्जय! मैं संन्यास और कर्म-योग को अलग-अलग समझता हूँ।
verses.english_translation: Arjuna said: O Dhananjaya! I regard renunciation and yoga of action as distinct.
verses.commentary: Arjuna seeks clarification on the relationship between renunciation and action.

verses.transliteration: sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaś cha niḥ-śreyasa-karāv ubhau
verses.hindi_translation: संन्यास और कर्म-योग दोनों कल्याण के लिए हैं।
verses.english_translation: Both renunciation and yoga of action lead to the supreme goal.
verses.commentary: Repetition emphasizing the point that both paths are equally valid and effective.

verses.transliteration: sannyās stu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogyate
verses.hindi_translation: हे महाबाहो! किंतु संन्यास प्राप्त करना कठिन है।
verses.english_translation: O mighty-armed one! But renunciation is difficult to attain.
verses.commentary: Pure renunciation, without associated knowledge, is difficult and may be incomplete.

verses.transliteration: naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vit
verses.hindi_translation: जो तत्त्ववेत्ता है, वह सोचता है कि मैं कुछ नहीं कर रहा हूँ।
verses.english_translation: The person established in truth thinks, 'I am not doing anything.'
verses.commentary: True knowledge brings the understanding that the Self is not the doer of actions.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मयोगधरा यस्तु न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति।
verses.transliteration: karma-yoga-dharā yas tu na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati
verses.hindi_translation: जो कर्म-योग को धारण करता है, न किसी से द्वेष करता है, न काम करता है।
verses.english_translation: One who performs action without hatred or craving is the true yogi.
verses.commentary: The yogi of action performs duties with detachment and equanimity.

verses.transliteration: kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalairindriyair api
verses.hindi_translation: शरीर, मन, बुद्धि और इंद्रियों से कर्म-योग का अभ्यास करते हुए।
verses.english_translation: Even while performing actions through the body, mind, intellect, and senses.
verses.commentary: Practical guidance on how to engage in action while maintaining inner detachment.

verses.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasya āste sukham
verses.hindi_translation: सभी कर्मों को मन से त्यागकर, शरीर में ही सुख से रहता है।
verses.english_translation: The wise person, having renounced all actions mentally, dwells in peace in the body.
verses.commentary: Mental renunciation while physically performing duties leads to peace.

verses.transliteration: jñānena tu tad ajñānaṁ yeṣāṁ nāśitam ātmanaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जिनके आत्मा का अज्ञान ज्ञान से नष्ट हो गया है।
verses.english_translation: Those whose ignorance is destroyed by knowledge of the Self.
verses.commentary: Knowledge of the Self is the ultimate destroyer of ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूत प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति।
verses.transliteration: brahma-bhūta prasannātmā na śochati na kāṅkṣati
verses.hindi_translation: ब्रह्म में स्थित, प्रसन्न आत्मा वाला न शोक करता है, न काम करता है।
verses.english_translation: Established in Brahman, with a peaceful Self, one neither grieves nor desires.
verses.commentary: The state of brahma-bhuta - merger of individual consciousness with universal consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि शुनि चैव श्वपाके।
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇe gavi hastini śuni chaiva śva-pāke
verses.hindi_translation: ब्राह्मण, गाय, हाथी, कुत्ता और मलेच्छ सभी में समान दृष्टि है।
verses.english_translation: The wise one sees the same Self in a learned person, a cow, an elephant, and a dog.
verses.commentary: The vision of equanimity extends to all beings - seeing the same Atman everywhere.

verses.sanskrit: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः।
verses.transliteration: ihaiv tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जिनका मन समता में स्थित है, वे इसी लोक में सृष्टि को जीत लेते हैं।
verses.english_translation: Those whose mind is fixed in equanimity conquer the world even here.
verses.commentary: Equanimity is the key to spiritual liberation and inner freedom.

verses.transliteration: na prahṛṣyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijeta prāpya chāpriyam
verses.hindi_translation: प्रिय पाकर न हर्षित हो, अप्रिय पाकर न विषादी हो।
verses.english_translation: One should not be elated on obtaining the agreeable, nor depressed on obtaining the disagreeable.
verses.commentary: The practice of equanimity in dealing with life's ups and downs.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते।
verses.transliteration: yasya nāhaṅ-kṛto bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyate
verses.hindi_translation: जिसका अहंकार नष्ट हो गया है, जिसकी बुद्धि आसक्त नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: One who has no ego and whose intellect is not attached.
verses.commentary: The dissolution of ego-sense leads to freedom and realization.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna teaches the practice of meditation and the importance of discipline. He describes the path of Yoga for achieving union with the divine and the characteristics of the perfect yogi.

verses.transliteration: ārurukṣor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate
verses.hindi_translation: योग की इच्छा करने वाले मुनि के लिए कर्म साधन कहा जाता है।
verses.english_translation: For the aspirant on the path of Yoga, action is said to be the means.
verses.commentary: Action is the foundation for the practice of meditation and spiritual development.

verses.transliteration: uddhared ātmanā 'ātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet
verses.hindi_translation: अपने आप को आत्मा से उन्नत करो, अपने आप को नीचा मत करो।
verses.english_translation: Elevate yourself through the power of the Self, do not degrade yourself.
verses.commentary: Self-reliance and self-effort are key to spiritual progress - no one can save you but yourself.

verses.transliteration: bandhu rātmā 'ātmanas tasya yenā 'ātmaiv ātmanā jitaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जिसने आत्मा को आत्मा से जीत लिया, वह स्वयं ही अपना मित्र है।
verses.english_translation: The Self is the friend of those who have mastered the Self by the Self.
verses.commentary: The Self that is controlled becomes one's greatest ally.

verses.transliteration: jitātmanaḥ praśāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जिसने आत्मा को जीत लिया, वह शांत है, और परमात्मा उसमें समाहित है।
verses.english_translation: For one who has conquered the Self and achieved peace, the Supreme Self is always present.
verses.commentary: The reward of self-mastery is the constant presence of the divine within.

verses.transliteration: śuchau deśe pratiṣṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: शुद्ध स्थान पर दृढ़ आसन लगाकर।
verses.english_translation: In a clean place, having established a firm seat.
verses.commentary: The physical environment and posture are important for serious meditation practice.

verses.transliteration: tatra taika-gryaṁ manaḥ kṛtvā yat-chittendiya-kriyaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: वहाँ मन को एकाग्र करके, मन और इंद्रियों को नियंत्रित करके।
verses.english_translation: There, fixing the mind on a single point and controlling the mind and senses.
verses.commentary: Concentration and control of the senses are prerequisites for meditation.

verses.sanskrit: योगी यञ्जति मनः सर्वं कामकामा त्यजाय च।
verses.transliteration: yogī yañjati manaḥ sarvaṁ kāma-kāmā tyajāy cha
verses.hindi_translation: योगी सभी कामनाओं को त्यागकर मन को नियंत्रित करता है।
verses.english_translation: The yogi, controlling the mind, renounces all desires and concentrates the mind.
verses.commentary: The yogi must renounce even the desire for worldly possessions and pleasures.

verses.transliteration: yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmany ev avatiṣṭhate
verses.hindi_translation: जब नियंत्रित चित्त आत्मा में ही लीन हो जाता है।
verses.english_translation: When the controlled mind becomes absorbed in the Self.
verses.commentary: The goal of meditation - the merger of individual consciousness with universal consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता।
verses.transliteration: yathā dīpo nivātas-tho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā
verses.hindi_translation: जैसे शांत स्थान पर दीप अचल रहता है, ऐसा ही योगी का चित्त रहता है।
verses.english_translation: As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, such is the yogi with controlled mind.
verses.commentary: The simile of the steady lamp illustrating the stability of the meditative mind.

verses.transliteration: yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā
verses.hindi_translation: जहाँ योग के अभ्यास से चित्त की शांति हो जाती है।
verses.english_translation: Where the mind, withdrawn by yoga practice, attains complete rest.
verses.commentary: The state of nirvikalpa samadhi - meditation without any mental modifications.

verses.transliteration: taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viprayogaṁ yoga-sañjñitam
verses.hindi_translation: उस दुःख से अलगाव को योग कहते हैं।
verses.english_translation: That disassociation from suffering is called Yoga.
verses.commentary: The ultimate definition of Yoga - liberation from suffering through union with the Self.

verses.transliteration: yato yato niścharati manas chañchalam asthiram
verses.hindi_translation: जहाँ-जहाँ अस्थिर मन चंचल होकर भटकता है।
verses.english_translation: From wherever the restless and unsteady mind wanders.
verses.commentary: The challenge of meditation - bringing back the wandering mind to the present moment.

verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu yoga-yukto bhav ārjun
verses.hindi_translation: इसलिए हे अर्जुन! सभी समय योग में लगे रहो।
verses.english_translation: Therefore, O Arjuna! Be always engaged in Yoga.
verses.commentary: Constant practice and vigilance are necessary for spiritual progress.

verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūtātmā-bhūtātmā sarva-bhūtāni chātmani
verses.hindi_translation: जो सभी प्राणियों में आत्मा को और आत्मा में सभी प्राणियों को देखता है।
verses.english_translation: The yogi sees the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self.
verses.commentary: The vision of universal oneness - the ultimate achievement of Yoga practice.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वत्र समदर्शी यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र।
verses.transliteration: sarvatra sama-darśī yo māṁ paśyati sarvatra
verses.hindi_translation: जो सब जगह समभाव से मुझे देखता है, और जो सब जगह मुझे देखता है।
verses.english_translation: The yogi who sees Me everywhere and perceives all in Me.
verses.commentary: Divine love and devotion combined with equanimity is the highest form of Yoga.

verses.transliteration: ātma-aupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśyati yo 'rjun
verses.hindi_translation: हे अर्जुन! जो सब जगह आत्म-साम्य से समभाव से देखता है।
verses.english_translation: O Arjuna! The yogi who sees equality everywhere based on the analogy of the Self.
verses.commentary: The practical implication of yoga - universal love and compassion based on self-knowledge.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna reveals his divine nature and the cosmic manifestation. He describes how he is the source of all creation and the ultimate reality beyond all material existence.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मयि मनः समाधेय मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय।।
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvācha mayi manaḥ samādhey mayi buddhiṁ niveśay
verses.hindi_translation: श्रीभगवान ने कहा: मुझमें अपना मन लगाओ और मुझमें अपनी बुद्धि को समर्पित करो।
verses.english_translation: The Blessed Lord said: Fix your mind on Me, dedicate your intellect to Me.
verses.commentary: The path of devotion - complete surrender of mind and intellect to the divine.

verses.sanskrit: न हि ज्ञानेन समं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।
verses.transliteration: na hi jñānena samaṁ pavitram iha vidyate
verses.hindi_translation: इस संसार में ज्ञान के समान पवित्र कुछ नहीं है।
verses.english_translation: There is nothing in this world as pure as knowledge.
verses.commentary: Knowledge is the supreme purifier and the path to ultimate liberation.

verses.sanskrit: रसः अहं अप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः।
verses.transliteration: rasaḥ ahaṁ apsu kauntey prabhāsmi śaśi-sūryayoḥ
verses.hindi_translation: हे कुंती के पुत्र! मैं जल में रस हूँ, सूर्य और चंद्र में प्रकाश हूँ।
verses.english_translation: O son of Kunti! I am the taste in water, the light in the sun and moon.
verses.commentary: Krishna describes his manifestation in all aspects of creation - the divine pervades all existence.

verses.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्।
verses.transliteration: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārth sanātanam
verses.hindi_translation: हे पार्थ! मैं सभी प्राणियों का शाश्वत बीज हूँ।
verses.english_translation: O Partha! Know that I am the eternal seed of all beings.
verses.commentary: God is the ultimate source and sustaining principle of all existence.

verses.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः।
verses.transliteration: na māṁ duṣ-kṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhāmāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: दुष्कर्मी और मूर्ख मनुष्य मेरी शरण नहीं लेते।
verses.english_translation: The wicked and foolish do not surrender to Me.
verses.commentary: Spiritual progress requires ethical conduct and wisdom.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna teaches about the ultimate reality and the process of liberation at the time of death. He explains how remembering him at the moment of death leads to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम।।
verses.transliteration: arjun uvācha kiṁ tad brahm kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣottam
verses.hindi_translation: अर्जुन ने पूछा: हे पुरुषोत्तम! वह ब्रह्म क्या है, वह आत्मा क्या है?
verses.english_translation: Arjuna asked: O Supreme Person! What is Brahman, what is the Atman, what is action?
verses.commentary: Arjuna seeks clarification on the fundamental concepts of Brahman, Atman, and karma.

verses.transliteration: akṣaraṁ brahm paramaṁ sva-bhāvo 'dhyātmam uchyate
verses.hindi_translation: परब्रह्म अक्षर है, और आत्मा को स्वभाव कहते हैं।
verses.english_translation: The Supreme Brahman is imperishable. The nature of the individual being is called Adhyatma.
verses.commentary: Definition of fundamental concepts - Brahman as the absolute and Atman as individual consciousness.

verses.transliteration: anta-kāle cha mām ev smaran muktvā kalevaram
verses.hindi_translation: अंत समय में जो मुझे स्मरण करते हुए शरीर को त्यागता है।
verses.english_translation: One who remembers Me at the time of death, leaving the body, attains My being.
verses.commentary: The importance of remembrance at the moment of death - it determines one's next birth.

verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu mām anusmar yudhy cha
verses.hindi_translation: इसलिए सभी समय मुझे स्मरण करते हुए कर्तव्य पालन करो।
verses.english_translation: Therefore, at all times remember Me and perform your duty.
verses.commentary: Constant remembrance of the divine combined with duty is the path to liberation.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna reveals the greatest knowledge and the supreme secret. He teaches about his transcendental nature and the method of devotion to reach him.

verses.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam
verses.hindi_translation: यह राज-विद्या, राज-गुह्य, परम पवित्र और सर्वश्रेष्ठ है।
verses.english_translation: This is the royal science, the royal secret, most purifying and supreme.
verses.commentary: The knowledge of the divine is called the royal secret because it grants supreme power and peace.

verses.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagan avyakta-mūrtinā
verses.hindi_translation: मैं अव्यक्त रूप से इस संपूर्ण जगत को व्याप्त किए हुए हूँ।
verses.english_translation: I pervade this entire universe in My unmanifest form.
verses.commentary: The divine omnipresence - God is the substratum of all existence.

verses.sanskrit: येषामहं प्रिय आत्मा तस्य ज्ञानिनां नित्ययुक्तानाम्।
verses.transliteration: yeṣām ahaṁ priya ātmā tasya jñāninām nitya-yuktānām
verses.hindi_translation: मैं उन ज्ञानियों का प्रिय हूँ जो मुझमें नित्य लगे हुए हैं।
verses.english_translation: I am the Self of the wise ones who are always united with Me.
verses.commentary: The intimate relationship between the divine and those who seek him with devotion and knowledge.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna describes his divine manifestations and glories. He explains his presence in various forms and powers throughout creation.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते।
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate
verses.hindi_translation: मैं सभी का मूल कारण हूँ, मुझसे सब कुछ उत्पन्न होता है।
verses.english_translation: I am the source of all. Everything emanates from Me. The wise know this and engage in My worship.
verses.commentary: God is the ultimate cause and sustaining principle of all existence.

verses.transliteration: mac-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam
verses.hindi_translation: जिनका चित्त मुझमें लगा है, जिनका प्राण मुझमें समर्पित है।
verses.english_translation: Those whose minds are devoted to Me and whose lives are dedicated to Me.
verses.commentary: The characteristics of devoted followers - complete mental and physical dedication to the divine.

verses.transliteration: aham ātmā gudākeśa sarva-bhūtāśaya-sthitaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: हे गुडाकेश! मैं सभी प्राणियों के हृदय में स्थित आत्मा हूँ।
verses.english_translation: O Gudakesa! I am the Atman, the Self seated in the heart of all beings.
verses.commentary: The divine indwells in every being as the innermost Self.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna reveals his cosmic form to Arjuna. This chapter describes the magnificent vision of the universal form that encompasses all existence.

verses.transliteration: aneka-bāhu-uro-vaktra-netram paśya me yogam aiśvaram
verses.hindi_translation: अनेक भुजाओं, पेटों, मुँहों और आँखों वाला मेरा योग देखो।
verses.english_translation: Behold, My divine yoga! Innumerable arms, bodies, mouths, and eyes!
verses.commentary: The cosmic form displays the infinite nature of the divine.

verses.transliteration: ananta-viryām-ita-vikram astvam sarvasya lokasya paramaṁ nidhānam
verses.hindi_translation: अनंत शक्ति और अपरिमित विक्रम वाले तुम सभी लोकों का परम धन हो।
verses.english_translation: You are of infinite power and immeasurable prowess. You are the ultimate treasure of all worlds.
verses.commentary: Arjuna acknowledges the infinite and transcendent nature of the divine.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna teaches that devotion is the path to the divine. He explains that those who are devoted to him with faith reach him.

verses.transliteration: ke yoga-vittamā ete yoginām agannā mam
verses.hindi_translation: ये योगी मेरे लिए सर्वश्रेष्ठ हैं?
verses.english_translation: Who among these yogis are most perfect, O Lord?
verses.commentary: Arjuna asks which path of yoga is the most excellent.

verses.transliteration: ye pi akṣaram-anirddeśyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate
verses.hindi_translation: जो अव्यक्त परब्रह्म की आराधना करते हैं।
verses.english_translation: Those who meditate on the unmanifest, imperishable Brahman.
verses.commentary: The path of abstract meditation on the formless ultimate reality.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः।
verses.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जो सभी कर्मों को मुझमें अर्पित करके मुझ पर निर्भर रहते हैं।
verses.english_translation: Those who surrender all their actions to Me and are devoted to Me.
verses.commentary: The path of devotion and complete surrender is the simplest and most direct path.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेषा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च।
verses.transliteration: adveṣā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva cha
verses.hindi_translation: जो सभी प्राणियों से निर्द्वेष, मित्रवत और करुणामय है।
verses.english_translation: One who is free from hatred toward all beings, compassionate and kind.
verses.commentary: The qualities of a true devotee - universal love and compassion.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna explains the nature of the field (body) and the knower of the field (consciousness). He describes the twenty-five elements of nature.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत।
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-jñaṁ chāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣetreṣu bhārat
verses.hindi_translation: हे भारत! सभी क्षेत्रों (शरीरों) में मुझे क्षेत्रज्ञ जानो।
verses.english_translation: O Bharata! Know Me to be the Knower of the field in all bodies.
verses.commentary: The supreme consciousness is the witness and knower of all material bodies.

verses.transliteration: paramaṁ brahm paramātmā jyotir ekam tanute
verses.hindi_translation: परब्रह्म, परमात्मा, एकमात्र ज्योति है।
verses.english_translation: The Supreme Brahman, the Paramatman, is the single light of consciousness.
verses.commentary: The ultimate reality is singular, pure consciousness that illuminates all existence.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna explains the three gunas - Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas. He describes how these qualities of nature condition all beings.

verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ rajas tam iti guṇāḥ prakṛti-sambhavāḥ
verses.hindi_translation: सत्त्व, रज और तम ये तीन गुण प्रकृति से उत्पन्न हैं।
verses.english_translation: Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas are the three qualities born of nature.
verses.commentary: All existence is composed of these three qualities in varying proportions.

verses.transliteration: rājo 'bhivardhate kāmaiḥ tṛṣṇābhir arjun
verses.hindi_translation: हे अर्जुन! राजस गुण कामनाओं और तृष्णा से बढ़ता है।
verses.english_translation: O Arjuna! Rajas increases with desires and cravings.
verses.commentary: The quality of passion is sustained by unfulfilled desires and attachments.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna describes himself as the supreme spirit beyond the perishable and imperishable. He teaches about the nature of the supreme reality.

verses.transliteration: ūrdhv-mūlam adhaḥ-śākhm aśvatthaṁ prāhur avyayam
verses.hindi_translation: ऊर्ध्व मूल और अधः शाखों वाले अश्वत्थ को अव्यय कहते हैं।
verses.english_translation: The eternal Ashvattha tree is said to have roots above and branches below.
verses.commentary: The cosmic tree metaphor representing the creation with the divine as the root.

verses.transliteration: yasmāt kṣaram atīto 'ham akṣarād api chottamaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: चूँकि मैं क्षर से परे हूँ और अक्षर से भी श्रेष्ठ हूँ।
verses.english_translation: Since I am superior to both the perishable and the imperishable.
verses.commentary: Krishna's supreme position as beyond all categories of existence.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna divides qualities into divine and demonic. He explains the characteristics that lead to liberation and those that lead to bondage.

verses.transliteration: abhayaṁ sattva-saṁśuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ
verses.hindi_translation: अभय, सत्त्व की शुद्धि, ज्ञान-योग में स्थिति - ये दैव सम्पदा हैं।
verses.english_translation: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga are divine qualities.
verses.commentary: The divine qualities lead to spiritual progress and ultimate liberation.

verses.transliteration: daivī sampad vimokṣāya nibandhānaā tāmasī
verses.hindi_translation: दैव सम्पद मोक्ष के लिए है, आसुरी सम्पद बंधन के लिए है।
verses.english_translation: Divine qualities lead to liberation, demonic qualities lead to bondage.
verses.commentary: The two paths - one leads to freedom, the other to slavery.

chapters.chapter_summary: Krishna discusses the three types of faith corresponding to the three gunas. He explains how faith is the basis of all actions.

verses.sanskrit: श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः।
verses.transliteration: śraddhā-mayo 'yaṁ puruṣo yo yac-chraddhah sa eva saḥ
verses.hindi_translation: जैसा श्रद्धा का व्यक्ति, वह वैसा ही है।
verses.english_translation: A person is made of the stuff of his faith. As his faith is, so is he.
verses.commentary: Faith is the determining factor of a person's character and spiritual development.

verses.transliteration: śraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat-trividhaṁ naraiḥ
verses.hindi_translation: परम श्रद्धा से किया गया तप तीन प्रकार का है।
verses.english_translation: Austerity practiced with supreme faith is of three types.
verses.commentary: The quality of austerity and spiritual practice depends on the faith with which it is performed.

chapters.chapter_summary: The final chapter concludes the Bhagavad Gita with Krishna explaining the nature of renunciation and the path to ultimate liberation.

verses.transliteration: ichchhā-dveṣa-samutthebhyu kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ madeḥ
verses.hindi_translation: इच्छा और द्वेष से उत्पन्न काम और क्रोध को त्यागना ही संन्यास है।
verses.english_translation: True renunciation is the renunciation of desire and aversion born from attraction and repulsion.
verses.commentary: The essence of renunciation is freedom from emotional reactions and attachments.

verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ braj
verses.hindi_translation: सभी धर्मों को त्यागकर, केवल मेरी शरण लो।
verses.english_translation: Abandoning all dharmas, surrender to Me alone.
verses.commentary: The final teaching - complete surrender to the divine is the ultimate path to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः।।
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ
verses.hindi_translation: मैं तुम्हें सभी पापों से मुक्त कर दूँगा। चिंता मत करो।
verses.english_translation: I shall liberate you from all sins. Do not grieve.
verses.commentary: The promise of divine grace and redemption - complete liberation through surrender.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुनः प्रह्र्ष्टः सुप्रेमो भयं च परमं गतः।।
verses.transliteration: arjunaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ supremo bhayaṁ cha paramaṁ gataḥ
verses.hindi_translation: अर्जुन अत्यंत प्रसन्न हुआ और उसका सभी भय दूर हो गया।
verses.english_translation: Arjuna was completely pleased and all his doubts and fears were removed.
verses.commentary: The resolution of Arjuna's crisis through the wisdom of Krishna.
